reviews.text: A great little place, with some lovely views, if you look.
An attractive historic railway station on the scenic Medway Valley Line.

Cant get a parking space in the carpark unless you get there at the crack of dawn. And too risky parking car outside station on the road has had my car scratched twice and an attempted theft side window smashed and door damaged has tried to be jimmied open . Has happened to a few friends of mine also. Would recommend iver walking walking to station or riding. But make sure you have a good bike lock has dont no if your bike will be there when you come back.
This s a very nice town I love snodland level crossing lowering it is so lovely so I will give it 10/10

I don't travel by train very often and was surprised to find snodland station has new parking(£3 per day) the station had reopened and the station office was manned at 06.45. All clean and tidy around the station, looks good. I used the fast service to London which cost £48.50 for a day return with travelcard, the service is good, the trains seem new and clean but it is a big cost and many people had no seats. If the seating at peak times could be sorted in some way I would give the service 5 stars. Thanks.
